p.s: Volatility in financial markets is a concern among finance professionals , traders and investors , and anybody else looking at the ongoing market situation for a particular region or exchange .
But volatility is a word that many individuals use in many different contexts .

If you need to measure market volatility as an investor or anyone up with a stake in changes to a financial market , here are some of the best ways to examine volatility , or changes in market price , according to some experienced professionals and others .

item.s: Choose a time frame in which to examine market volatility .
Volatility is a variable that is only accurate within a certain time frame .

That 's why most brokerage accounts and other services provide time adjustable charts that show how an asset , a market or a collection of financial products has changed over a specific amount of time .
Use formulas to further define volatility .
Within your given time frame , you can make use of simple or more complex formulas to calculate volatility technically .
Use an index to look at how volatility has affected multiple assets .
Single stocks or financial products have their own specific volatility within a market , but traders often use an index to define volatility for multiple stocks or products .
An index is simply a collection of values for stocks , funds and other products that provides a total change in price .
One of the most basic formulas for calculating volatility is the following : range multiplied by ( maximum price minus minimum price ) for your time period .
Other more complex formulas like VIX or Beta help finance professionals and others understand more about how prices are changing within a given market .
Calculate percentage changes .

Using individual assets or the index tools mentioned above , take a look at how much a price has changed over time and calculate that as a percentage of the total value to find a " total volatility " that you can use to predict future markets .
Assess various stock index tools to see how they can help you measure volatility .

For example , in the American market , the Dow Jones industrial average , a collection of blue-chip stocks , has its own volatility calculations that can help you better understand where a market has been and where it is going .
Evaluate moving averages .
For many traders , it 's not enough just to see how much a price has changed .
It 's also important to see which direction that change has gone within a greater context .
Even if you have identified your specific time frame for volatility , you may want to go back further and look at how the stock or other asset has changed over a greater time frame .
A moving average helps financial professionals to do this by providing an average price for the asset over a longer period of time such as 1 year .
Account for market sentiments .
Use random number method like Random Number tables or concept of ' Brownian Motion for financial analysis ' especially in case of Stock market volatility .
